+
+package org.forgerock.http.util;
+
+import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;
+
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.UUID;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.BeforeMethod;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class CaseInsensitiveMapTest {
+
+    private CaseInsensitiveMap&lt;String&gt; map; // map to perform tests on
+    private String upper; // key as an upper-case string
+    private String lower; // key as a lower-case string
+    private String value1; // value to store and check for in mapping
+    private String value2; // value to replace original with to see that replacement sticks
+    private String spurious; // key to use to test spurious lookup
+
+    // ----- context -----------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @BeforeMethod
+    public void before() {
+        map = new CaseInsensitiveMap&lt;String&gt;(new HashMap&lt;String, String&gt;());
+        upper = &quot;AAA-&quot; + UUID.randomUUID().toString().toUpperCase() + &quot;-BBB&quot;;
+        lower = upper.toLowerCase();
+        value1 = UUID.randomUUID().toString();
+        value2 = UUID.randomUUID().toString();
+        spurious = &quot;aaa-&quot; + UUID.randomUUID().toString() + &quot;-BBB&quot;;
+    }
+
+    // ----- upper case --------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutKeyRetainsCase() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.keySet().iterator().next()).isEqualTo(upper);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutUpperGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isEqualTo(value1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutUpperContains() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.containsKey(upper)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutSpuriousContains() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.containsKey(spurious)).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutSpuriousGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.get(spurious)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutUpperRemoveUpperGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        map.remove(upper);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    // ----- lower case --------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutKeyRetainsCase() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.keySet().iterator().next()).isEqualTo(lower);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutLowerGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isEqualTo(value1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutLowerContains() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.containsKey(lower)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutSpuriousContains() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.containsKey(spurious)).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutSpuriousGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.get(spurious)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutLowerRemoveLowerGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        map.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    // ----- upper then lower case ---------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutLowerGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isEqualTo(value1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutLowerContains() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        assertThat(map.containsKey(lower)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutUpperRemoveLowerGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        map.remove(upper);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutLowerRemoveUpperGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        map.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutLowerRemoveLowerGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        map.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutLowerPutUpperGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        map.put(lower, value2);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isEqualTo(value2);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void upperPutLowerPutLowerGet() {
+        map.put(upper, value1);
+        map.put(lower, value2);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isEqualTo(value2);
+    }
+
+    // ----- lower then upper case ---------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutUpperGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isEqualTo(value1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutUpperContains() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        assertThat(map.containsKey(upper)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutLowerRemoveUpperGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        map.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutUpperRemoveLowerGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        map.remove(upper);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutUpperRemoveUpperGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        map.remove(upper);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutUpperPutLowerGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        map.put(upper, value2);
+        assertThat(map.get(lower)).isEqualTo(value2);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void lowerPutUpperPutUpperGet() {
+        map.put(lower, value1);
+        map.put(upper, value2);
+        assertThat(map.get(upper)).isEqualTo(value2);
+    }
+}
</ins><span class="cx">Property changes on: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/CaseInsensitiveMapTest.java
</span><span class="cx">___________________________________________________________________
</span></span></pre></div>
<a id="svneolstyle"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: svn:eol-style</h4></div>
<a id="forgerockhttpframeworktrunkhttpcoresrctestjavaorgforgerockhttputilCaseInsensitiveSetTestjava"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/CaseInsensitiveSetTest.java (0 => 2898)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/CaseInsensitiveSetTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/CaseInsensitiveSetTest.java        2015-02-04 17:48:07 UTC (rev 2898)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,233 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the
+ * License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions Copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2014 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.http.util;
+
+import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.*;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.Collection;
+import java.util.HashSet;
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.Set;
+import java.util.UUID;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.BeforeMethod;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class CaseInsensitiveSetTest {
+
+    private CaseInsensitiveSet set;
+    private static String upper;
+    private static String lower;
+
+    @BeforeMethod
+    public void before() {
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet();
+        upper = &quot;AAA-&quot; + UUID.randomUUID().toString().toUpperCase() + &quot;-BBB&quot;;
+        lower = upper.toLowerCase();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddUpperKey() {
+        set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(set.iterator().next()).isEqualTo(upper);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddUpperContains() {
+        set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(set).contains(upper);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddUpperTwice() {
+        boolean isAdded = set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(isAdded).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        isAdded = set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(isAdded).isFalse();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        assertThat(set).containsOnly(upper);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddUpperRemove() {
+        set.add(upper);
+        set.remove(upper);
+        assertThat(set).isEmpty();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddLowerKey() {
+        set.add(lower);
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        assertThat(set.iterator().next()).isEqualTo(lower);
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1).containsOnly(lower);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddLowerRemove() {
+        set.add(lower);
+        set.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(set).isEmpty();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddUpperLowerRemove() {
+        boolean isAdded = set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(isAdded).isTrue();
+        isAdded = set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(isAdded).isFalse();
+        set.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(set).isEmpty();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddUpperLowerClear() {
+        set.add(lower);
+        set.add(upper);
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        set.clear();
+        assertThat(set).isEmpty();
+    }
+
+    // TODO Stg wrong here : the set should contain only one entry as the addAll function did.
+    @Test
+    public void testAddFromListCollection() {
+        final Collection&lt;String&gt; listOfValues = createRegularListWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys();
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet(createRegularListWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys());
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(listOfValues.size()); // 2?
+        assertThat(set).contains(upper, lower);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddFromListCollection2() {
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet();
+        final boolean isChanged = set.addAll(createRegularListWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys());
+        assertThat(isChanged).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        // FIXME Looks horrible but it seems assertj doesn't use the right contains method.
+        // assertThat(set).contains(upper).contains(lower);
+        assertThat(set.contains(lower)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.contains(upper)).isTrue();
+        set.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(set).isEmpty();
+    }
+
+    // TODO Stg wrong here : the set should contain only one entry as the addAll function did.
+    @Test
+    public void testAddFromSetCollection() {
+        final Collection&lt;String&gt; listOfValues = createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys();
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet(listOfValues);
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(listOfValues.size()); // 2?
+        assertThat(set.contains(lower)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.contains(upper)).isTrue();
+        set.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAddFromSetCollection2() {
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet();
+        final boolean isChanged = set.addAll(createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys());
+        assertThat(isChanged).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        assertThat(set.contains(lower)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.contains(upper)).isTrue();
+        set.remove(lower);
+        assertThat(set).isEmpty();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testContainsAllFromSetCollection() {
+        final Collection&lt;String&gt; mySet = createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys();
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet();
+        final boolean isChanged = set.addAll(mySet);
+        assertThat(isChanged).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        assertThat(set.contains(lower)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.contains(upper)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.containsAll(mySet)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testContainsAllFromSetCollectionDoesNothing() {
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet(1);
+        final boolean isChanged = set.addAll(createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys());
+        assertThat(isChanged).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        assertThat(set.contains(lower)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.contains(upper)).isTrue();
+
+        final Set&lt;String&gt; another = new HashSet&lt;String&gt;();
+        another.add(&quot;OpenIG&quot;);
+        assertThat(set.containsAll(another)).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    /** TODO This one throw a ConcurrentModificationException - The retain method needs to be rewrited with iterator. */
+    @Test(enabled = false)
+    public void testRetainAllFromSetCollection() {
+        set.add(upper);        // Contained in getSet()
+        set.add(&quot;OpenIG&quot;);     // Not contained in the getSet()
+        set.add(&quot;OpenIG2&quot;);    // Not contained in the getSet()
+        final boolean isChanged = set.retainAll(createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys());
+        assertThat(isChanged).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).contains(upper);
+        assertThat(set).doesNotContain(&quot;OpenIG&quot;);
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+    }
+
+    @Test(enabled = false)
+    public void testRetainAllFromSetCollectionDoesNothing() {
+        set.add(upper);       // Contained in getSet()
+        set.add(&quot;OpenIG&quot;);    // Not contained in the getSet()
+        final boolean isChanged = set.retainAll(createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys());
+        assertThat(isChanged).isFalse();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(1);
+        assertThat(set).contains(upper);
+    }
+
+    /** TODO This one throw a ConcurrentModificationException -
+     * The removeAll method needs to be rewrited with iterator. */
+    @Test(enabled = false)
+    public void testRemoveAllFromSetCollection() {
+        final Collection&lt;String&gt; mySet = createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys();
+        set = new CaseInsensitiveSet();
+        set.add(upper);
+        set.add(lower);
+        final boolean isChanged = set.removeAll(mySet);
+        assertThat(isChanged).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set).hasSize(0);
+        assertThat(set.contains(lower)).isFalse();
+        assertThat(set.contains(&quot;OpenIG&quot;)).isTrue();
+        assertThat(set.containsAll(mySet)).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    private static Collection&lt;String&gt; createRegularListWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys() {
+        final List&lt;String&gt; sample = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();
+        sample.add(upper);
+        sample.add(lower);
+        return sample;
+    }
+
+    private static Collection&lt;String&gt; createRegularSetWithUpperAndLowerCasedKeys() {
+        final Set&lt;String&gt; hashSet = new HashSet&lt;String&gt;();
+        hashSet.add(upper);
+        hashSet.add(lower);
+        return hashSet;
+    }
+}
</ins><span class="cx">Property changes on: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/CaseInsensitiveSetTest.java
</span><span class="cx">___________________________________________________________________
</span></span></pre></div>
<a id="svneolstyle"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: svn:eol-style</h4></div>
<a id="forgerockhttpframeworktrunkhttpcoresrctestjavaorgforgerockhttputilJsonTestjava"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/JsonTest.java (0 => 2898)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/JsonTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/JsonTest.java        2015-02-04 17:48:07 UTC (rev 2898)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,304 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the
+ * License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2014-2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.http.util;
+
+import static java.lang.Long.*;
+import static java.util.Arrays.*;
+import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;
+import static org.forgerock.http.util.Json.*;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.io.Reader;
+import java.io.StringReader;
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.Map;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class JsonTest {
+
+    private static final String INVALID_JSON = &quot;invalid json&quot;;
+    private static final String JSON_CONTENT =
+            &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' }&quot;;
+
+    @DataProvider
+    private Object[][] emptyJson() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+            { &quot;&quot; },
+            { &quot;\n&quot; } };
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    private Object[][] newLine() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+            { &quot;\r\n&quot; },
+            { &quot;\n&quot; } };
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    private Object[][] invalidJson() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+            { &quot;{ 'name':'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler },&quot; }, // Missing quote within the sample.
+            { &quot;{ 'name':, 'type': 'ClientHandler' },&quot; }, // A comma too many.
+            { &quot;{ 'name':, 'type': 'ClientHandler' }&quot; }, // Missing attribute value.
+            { &quot;{ :'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' }&quot; }}; // Missing attribute name.
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;emptyJson&quot;)
+    public void shouldReturnsNullWhenSerializingEmptyString(final String json) throws Exception {
+        assertThat(readJson(from(json))).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IOException.class)
+    public void shouldFailToReadInvalidJson() throws Exception {
+        readJson(from(INVALID_JSON));
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;invalidJson&quot;, expectedExceptions = IOException.class)
+    public void testFailParsingInvalidJson(final String invalid)
+            throws Exception {
+        readJson(from(invalid));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldParsingSucceedWhenCommentsEnabledBlockommentInsideBlock() throws Exception {
+        final String sample =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' /* This is a comment */ } &quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; json = readJsonLenient(from(sample));
+        assertThat(json.get(&quot;name&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;outputHandler&quot;);
+        assertThat(json.get(&quot;type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;ClientHandler&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldParsingSucceedWhenCommentsEnabledBlockCommentOutsideBlock() throws Exception {
+        final String sample =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' } /* This is a comment */ &quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; json = readJsonLenient(from(sample));
+        assertThat(json.get(&quot;name&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;outputHandler&quot;);
+        assertThat(json.get(&quot;type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;ClientHandler&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldParsingSucceedWhenCommentsEnabledLineCommentOutsideBlock() throws Exception {
+        final String sample =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' } // This is a comment&quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; json = readJsonLenient(from(sample));
+        assertThat(json.get(&quot;name&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;outputHandler&quot;);
+        assertThat(json.get(&quot;type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;ClientHandler&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IOException.class)
+    public void shouldParsingFailWhenCommentsEnabledLineCommentInsideBlock() throws Exception {
+        final String sample =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' // This is a comment }&quot;;
+        readJsonLenient(from(sample));
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IOException.class)
+    public void shouldParsingFailWhenCommentsDisabled() throws Exception {
+        final String sample =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' /* This is a comment */ } &quot;;
+        readJson(from(sample));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldCommentsIgnoredByParsing() throws IOException {
+        final String sample =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' /* This is a comment */ } &quot;;
+
+        final String sample2 =
+                &quot;{ 'name': 'outputHandler', 'type': 'ClientHandler' } &quot;;
+
+        assertThat(readJsonLenient(from(sample))).isEqualTo(readJson(from(sample2)));
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;newLine&quot;, expectedExceptions = IOException.class)
+    public void shouldThrowIoExceptionWhenContainingEol(final String newLine) throws IOException {
+        readJson(singleQuotesToDouble(&quot;{ 'comment': 'Two lines &quot; + newLine + &quot;of comment' }&quot;));
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * The lenient parser should allow use of EOL (included in the string
+     * value). It also allows use of ASCII chars &lt; 32.
+     * e.g.
+     *
+     * &lt;pre&gt;
+     * &quot;source&quot;: &quot;import org.forgerock.json.fluent.JsonValue;
+     *            logger.info(exchange.token.asJsonValue() as String);&quot;
+     * &lt;/pre&gt;
+     */
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;newLine&quot;)
+    public void shouldSucceedWhenContainingEol(final String newLine) throws IOException {
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; jackson =
+                readJsonLenient(from(&quot;{ 'comment': 'Two lines &quot; + newLine + &quot;of comment' }&quot;));
+        assertThat((String) jackson.get(&quot;comment&quot;)).matches(&quot;Two lines [\r\n]{1,2}of comment$&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testAllowsSimpleQuote() throws Exception {
+        final String sample = &quot;{ 'condition': true } &quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; jackson = readJsonLenient(new StringReader(sample));
+
+        assertThat((Boolean) jackson.get(&quot;condition&quot;)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testFromString() throws Exception {
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; jackson = readJson(from(JSON_CONTENT));
+
+        assertThat(jackson.get(&quot;name&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;outputHandler&quot;);
+        assertThat(jackson.get(&quot;type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;ClientHandler&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testStringAllowNullAttributeValue() throws Exception {
+
+        final String rawJson = &quot;{ 'name': null, 'type': 'ClientHandler' } &quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; jackson = readJson(from(rawJson));
+
+        assertThat(jackson.get(&quot;name&quot;)).isNull();
+        assertThat(jackson.get(&quot;type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;ClientHandler&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonValueNumber() throws Exception {
+
+        final String rawJson = &quot;{ 'number': 23, 'other': '27' } &quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; jackson = readJson(from(rawJson));
+
+        assertThat(jackson.get(&quot;number&quot;)).isEqualTo(23);
+        assertThat(jackson.get(&quot;other&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;27&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonValueSupportsLong() throws Exception {
+
+        final String rawJson = &quot;{ 'long': '&quot; + MAX_VALUE + &quot;'}&quot;;
+        final Map&lt;String, Object&gt; jackson = readJson(from(rawJson));
+
+        assertThat(parseLong(jackson.get(&quot;long&quot;).toString())).isEqualTo(MAX_VALUE);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldSucceedToParseArray() throws IOException {
+        final String rawJson = singleQuotesToDouble(&quot;['The', 100 ]&quot;);
+        final Object jsonNode = readJson(rawJson);
+        assertThat(jsonNode).isInstanceOf(List.class);
+        final List&lt;?&gt; values = (List&lt;?&gt;) jsonNode;
+        assertThat(values.get(0)).isEqualTo(&quot;The&quot;);
+        assertThat(values.get(1)).isEqualTo(100);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldSucceedToParseArray2() throws IOException {
+        final String rawJson = singleQuotesToDouble(&quot;['The', { 'data':'outputHandler'} ]&quot;);
+        final Object jsonNode = readJson(rawJson);
+        assertThat(jsonNode).isInstanceOf(List.class);
+        final List&lt;?&gt; values = (List&lt;?&gt;) jsonNode;
+        assertThat(values.get(0)).isEqualTo(&quot;The&quot;);
+        assertThat(values.get(1)).isInstanceOf(LinkedHashMap.class);
+        @SuppressWarnings(&quot;unchecked&quot;)
+        final LinkedHashMap&lt;String, Object&gt; val2 = (LinkedHashMap&lt;String, Object&gt;) values.get(1);
+        assertThat(val2.get(&quot;data&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;outputHandler&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testParsesBoolean() throws IOException {
+        final Object jsonNode = readJson(&quot;true&quot;);
+        assertThat(jsonNode).isInstanceOf(Boolean.class).isEqualTo(true);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Returns a string reader from the rawJson attribute.
+     *
+     * @param rawJson
+     *            Json string to read (can be single quoted).
+     * @return a string reader.
+     */
+    private Reader from(final String rawJson) {
+        return new StringReader(singleQuotesToDouble(rawJson));
+    }
+
+    /** Remove single quotes from a given string. */
+    private static String singleQuotesToDouble(final String value) {
+        return value.replace('\'', '\&quot;');
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonCompatibilityBoxedPrimitiveType() throws Exception {
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;boolean&quot;, true);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;integer&quot;, 1);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;short&quot;, (short) 12);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;long&quot;, -42L);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;float&quot;, 42.3F);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;double&quot;, 3.14159D);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;char&quot;, 'a');
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;byte&quot;, (byte) 'c');
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonCompatibilityWithCharSequences() throws Exception {
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;string&quot;, &quot;a string&quot;);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;string-buffer&quot;, new StringBuffer(&quot;a string buffer&quot;));
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;string-builder&quot;, new StringBuilder(&quot;a string builder&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonCompatibilityWithArrayOfString() throws Exception {
+        String[] strings = {&quot;one&quot;, &quot;two&quot;, &quot;three&quot;};
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;array&quot;, strings);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonCompatibilityWithListOfString() throws Exception {
+        String[] strings = {&quot;one&quot;, &quot;two&quot;, &quot;three&quot;};
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;array&quot;, asList(strings));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testJsonCompatibilityWithMapOfString() throws Exception {
+        Map&lt;String, String&gt; map = new HashMap&lt;String, String&gt;();
+        map.put(&quot;one&quot;, &quot;one&quot;);
+        map.put(&quot;two&quot;, &quot;two&quot;);
+        map.put(&quot;three&quot;, &quot;three&quot;);
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;map&quot;, map);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class)
+    public void shouldNotAcceptUnsupportedTypes() throws Exception {
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;object&quot;, new Object());
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class,
+          expectedExceptionsMessageRegExp = &quot;.*'list\\[1\\]'.*&quot;)
+    public void shouldWriteErrorTrailForIncorrectList() throws Exception {
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;list&quot;, asList(&quot;one&quot;, new Object(), &quot;three&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class,
+          expectedExceptionsMessageRegExp = &quot;.*'map/object'.*&quot;)
+    public void shouldWriteErrorTrailForIncorrectMap() throws Exception {
+        Map&lt;String, Object&gt; map = new HashMap&lt;String, Object&gt;();
+        map.put(&quot;one&quot;, &quot;one&quot;);
+        map.put(&quot;object&quot;, new Object());
+        checkJsonCompatibility(&quot;map&quot;, map);
+    }
+}
</ins><span class="cx">Property changes on: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/JsonTest.java
</span><span class="cx">___________________________________________________________________
</span></span></pre></div>
<a id="svneolstyle"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: svn:eol-style</h4></div>
<a id="forgerockhttpframeworktrunkhttpcoresrctestjavaorgforgerockhttputilMultiValuedMapTestjava"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MultiValuedMapTest.java (0 => 2898)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MultiValuedMapTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MultiValuedMapTest.java        2015-02-04 17:48:07 UTC (rev 2898)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,144 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the
+ * License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2014 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.http.util;
+
+import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.*;
+
+import java.util.Arrays;
+import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
+import java.util.LinkedList;
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.Map;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class MultiValuedMapTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void addAllowsNull() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        mine.add(null, null);
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void add() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).contains(&quot;Half-and-half&quot;, &quot;Plus&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;coffee&quot;)).contains(&quot;Arabica&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        mine.add(&quot;syrup-type&quot;, &quot;Vanilla&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;syrup-type&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Vanilla&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test()
+    public void addToExistingValues() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).hasSize(2);
+
+        mine.add(&quot;milk-type&quot;, &quot;Steamed&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).hasSize(3);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).containsExactly(&quot;Half-and-half&quot;, &quot;Plus&quot;, &quot;Steamed&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void addAll() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        mine.addAll(&quot;syrup-type&quot;, Arrays.asList(&quot;Vanilla&quot;, &quot;Raspberry&quot;));
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;syrup-type&quot;)).hasSize(2);
+    }
+
+    @Test()
+    public void addAllMultivaluedMap() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getIcedCreamCoffee());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+        mine.addAll(new Coffee(getStandard()));
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(4);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Half-and-half&quot;, &quot;Plus&quot;, &quot;Cream&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;coffee&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Arabica&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;brew&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Iced&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;sugar&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;None&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test()
+    public void addAllKeyCollection() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getIcedCreamCoffee());
+        mine.addAll(&quot;milk-type&quot;, Arrays.asList(&quot;Steamed&quot;));
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Cream&quot;, &quot;Steamed&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;brew&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Iced&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;sugar&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;None&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void getFirst() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine.getFirst(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;Half-and-half&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void putSingleAllowsNull() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        mine.putSingle(null, null);
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void putSingle() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        mine.putSingle(&quot;syrup-type&quot;, &quot;Caramel&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(3);
+        assertThat(mine.getFirst(&quot;syrup-type&quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;Caramel&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void putSingleOverridesExistingValues() {
+        final Coffee mine = new Coffee(getStandard());
+        assertThat(mine).hasSize(2);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Half-and-half&quot;, &quot;Plus&quot;);
+        mine.putSingle(&quot;milk-type&quot;, &quot;Steamed&quot;);
+        assertThat(mine.get(&quot;milk-type&quot;)).containsOnly(&quot;Steamed&quot;);
+    }
+
+    private static Map&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt; getStandard() {
+        final Map&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt; custom = new LinkedHashMap&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt;();
+        custom.put(&quot;milk-type&quot;, new LinkedList&lt;String&gt;(Arrays.asList(&quot;Half-and-half&quot;, &quot;Plus&quot;)));
+        custom.put(&quot;coffee&quot;, new LinkedList&lt;String&gt;(Arrays.asList(&quot;Arabica&quot;)));
+        return custom;
+    }
+
+    private static Map&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt; getIcedCreamCoffee() {
+        final Map&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt; custom = new LinkedHashMap&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt;();
+        custom.put(&quot;milk-type&quot;, new LinkedList&lt;String&gt;(Arrays.asList(&quot;Cream&quot;)));
+        custom.put(&quot;brew&quot;, new LinkedList&lt;String&gt;(Arrays.asList(&quot;Iced&quot;)));
+        custom.put(&quot;sugar&quot;, new LinkedList&lt;String&gt;(Arrays.asList(&quot;None&quot;)));
+        return custom;
+    }
+
+    private class Coffee extends MultiValueMap&lt;String, String&gt; {
+        Coffee(Map&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt; map) {
+            super(new LinkedHashMap&lt;String, List&lt;String&gt;&gt;(map));
+        }
+    }
+}
</ins><span class="cx">Property changes on: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MultiValuedMapTest.java
</span><span class="cx">___________________________________________________________________
</span></span></pre></div>
<a id="svneolstyle"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: svn:eol-style</h4></div>
<a id="forgerockhttpframeworktrunkhttpcoresrctestjavaorgforgerockhttputilMutableUriTestjava"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MutableUriTest.java (0 => 2898)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MutableUriTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MutableUriTest.java        2015-02-04 17:48:07 UTC (rev 2898)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,300 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the
+ * License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2014 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.http.util;
+
+import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;
+import static org.forgerock.http.MutableUri.uri;
+
+import java.net.URI;
+
+import org.forgerock.http.MutableUri;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class MutableUriTest {
+
+    // Test for un-encoded values
+    // ----------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldUpdateScheme() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setScheme(&quot;https&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;https://www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getScheme()).isEqualTo(&quot;https&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldUpdateHost() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setHost(&quot;openig.forgerock.org&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://openig.forgerock.org&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getHost()).isEqualTo(&quot;openig.forgerock.org&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldUpdatePort() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setPort(8080);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com:8080&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getPort()).isEqualTo(8080);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemovePort() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com:8080&quot;);
+        uri.setPort(-1);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getPort()).isEqualTo(-1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddUserInfo() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setUserInfo(&quot;bjensen:s3cr3t&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://bjensen:s3cr3t@www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getUserInfo()).isEqualTo(&quot;bjensen:s3cr3t&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldModifyUserInfo() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://bjensen:s3cr3t@www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setUserInfo(&quot;guillaume:password&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://guillaume:password@www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getUserInfo()).isEqualTo(&quot;guillaume:password&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveUserInfo() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://bjensen:s3cr3t@www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setUserInfo(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getUserInfo()).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddPath() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setPath(&quot;/openig space/fr&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com/openig%20space/fr&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getPath()).isEqualTo(&quot;/openig space/fr&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldModifyPath() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com/openig&quot;);
+        uri.setPath(&quot;/forgerock&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com/forgerock&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getPath()).isEqualTo(&quot;/forgerock&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemovePath() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com/openig&quot;);
+        uri.setPath(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+        // Note: because we rebuild the full URL at each modification, it seems the underlying URI find an empty path
+        // instead of a null pah
+        assertThat(uri.getPath()).isNullOrEmpty();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddQuery() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setQuery(&quot;one=two three&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com?one=two%20three&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getQuery()).isEqualTo(&quot;one=two three&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldModifyQuery() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com?one=two%20three&quot;);
+        uri.setQuery(&quot;a=b&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com?a=b&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getQuery()).isEqualTo(&quot;a=b&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveQuery() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com?a=b&quot;);
+        uri.setQuery(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getQuery()).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddFragment() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setFragment(&quot;marker one&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com#marker%20one&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getFragment()).isEqualTo(&quot;marker one&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldModifyFragment() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com#other&quot;);
+        uri.setFragment(&quot;marker one&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com#marker%20one&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getFragment()).isEqualTo(&quot;marker one&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveFragment() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com#marker&quot;);
+        uri.setFragment(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.getFragment()).isNull();
+    }
+
+    // Test for encoded values (URL encoded)
+    // ----------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddRawUserInfo() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setRawUserInfo(&quot;bjen%20sen:s3c%3Dr3t&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://bjen%20sen:s3c%3Dr3t@www.example.com&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveRawUserInfo() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://bjensen:s3cr3t@www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setRawUserInfo(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddRawPath() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setRawPath(&quot;/openig%20space/fr&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com/openig%20space/fr&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveRawPath() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com/openig&quot;);
+        uri.setRawPath(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddRawQuery() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setRawQuery(&quot;one=two%20three&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com?one=two%20three&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveRawQuery() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com?a=b&quot;);
+        uri.setRawQuery(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAddRawFragment() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setRawFragment(&quot;marker%20one&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com#marker%20one&quot;));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRemoveRawFragment() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com#marker&quot;);
+        uri.setRawFragment(null);
+        assertThat(uri).isEqualTo(uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;));
+    }
+
+    // Test for getter (raw and normal)
+    // ----------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void testGetters() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://my%20user:pass%3Fword@www.example.com:80/path%20space/fr?x=%3D#marker%20one&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getScheme()).isEqualTo(&quot;http&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getUserInfo()).isEqualTo(&quot;my user:pass?word&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawUserInfo()).isEqualTo(&quot;my%20user:pass%3Fword&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getHost()).isEqualTo(&quot;www.example.com&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getPort()).isEqualTo(80);
+        assertThat(uri.getAuthority()).isEqualTo(&quot;my user:pass?word@www.example.com:80&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawAuthority()).isEqualTo(&quot;my%20user:pass%3Fword@www.example.com:80&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getPath()).isEqualTo(&quot;/path space/fr&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawPath()).isEqualTo(&quot;/path%20space/fr&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getQuery()).isEqualTo(&quot;x==&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawQuery()).isEqualTo(&quot;x=%3D&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getFragment()).isEqualTo(&quot;marker one&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawFragment()).isEqualTo(&quot;marker%20one&quot;);
+    }
+
+    // Other methods
+    // ---------------------------------------
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRebaseSchemeHostAndPort() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+        uri.rebase(new URI(&quot;http://www.example.com:8080&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.toString())
+                .isEqualTo(&quot;http://www.example.com:8080/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRebaseSchemeHostAndPortAndIgnoringOtherElements() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+        uri.rebase(new URI(&quot;http://www.example.com:8080/mypath?a=b#marker&quot;));
+        assertThat(uri.toString())
+                .isEqualTo(&quot;http://www.example.com:8080/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+    }
+
+    // Tests for correct encoding of clear values with reserved characters in URI components
+    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+    // Note: It appears that when we re-create a URI with decoded values that contains reserved
+    // characters ('=', '?', ...) the URI inner parser doesn't re-encode properly the reserved char
+    // for some components.
+    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+    @Test(enabled = false)
+    public void shouldAcceptReservedCharactersInSetQuery() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setQuery(&quot;x=?&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getQuery()).isEqualTo(&quot;x=?&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawQuery()).isEqualTo(&quot;x=%3F&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test(enabled = false)
+    public void shouldAcceptReservedCharactersInSetPath() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setPath(&quot;/=&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getPath()).isEqualTo(&quot;/=&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawPath()).isEqualTo(&quot;/%3F&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test(enabled = false)
+    public void shouldAcceptReservedCharactersInSetFragment() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setFragment(&quot;marker=&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getFragment()).isEqualTo(&quot;marker=&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawFragment()).isEqualTo(&quot;marker%3F&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldAcceptReservedCharactersInSetUserInfo() throws Exception {
+        MutableUri uri = uri(&quot;http://www.example.com&quot;);
+        uri.setUserInfo(&quot;test:pass?word&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getUserInfo()).isEqualTo(&quot;test:pass?word&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.getRawUserInfo()).isEqualTo(&quot;test:pass%3Fword&quot;);
+    }
+}
</ins><span class="cx">Property changes on: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/MutableUriTest.java
</span><span class="cx">___________________________________________________________________
</span></span></pre></div>
<a id="svneolstyle"></a>
<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: svn:eol-style</h4></div>

<div class="addfile"><h4>Added: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/URIUtilTest.java (0 => 2898)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>

</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the
+ * License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions Copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2010â€“2011 ApexIdentity Inc.
+ * Portions Copyright 2011-2014 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.http.util;
+
+import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;
+
+import java.net.URI;
+
+import org.forgerock.http.Form;
+import org.forgerock.http.URIUtil;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class URIUtilTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void toURIandBack() throws Exception {
+        URI u1 = URIUtil.create(&quot;a&quot;, &quot;b&quot;, &quot;c&quot;, 4, &quot;/e%3D&quot;, &quot;x=%3D&quot;, &quot;g%3D&quot;);
+        URI u2 = URIUtil.create(u1.getScheme(), u1.getRawUserInfo(), u1.getHost(),
+                u1.getPort(), u1.getRawPath(), u1.getRawQuery(), u1.getRawFragment());
+        assertThat(u1).isEqualTo(u2);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void rawParams() throws Exception {
+        URI uri = URIUtil.create(&quot;http&quot;, &quot;user&quot;, &quot;example.com&quot;, 80, &quot;/raw%3Dpath&quot;,
+                &quot;x=%3D&quot;, &quot;frag%3Dment&quot;);
+        assertThat(uri.toString()).isEqualTo(&quot;http://user@example.com:80/raw%3Dpath?x=%3D#frag%3Dment&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void rebase() throws Exception {
+        URI uri = new URI(&quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+        URI base = new URI(&quot;http://www.example.com/&quot;);
+        URI rebased = URIUtil.rebase(uri, base);
+        assertThat(rebased.toString()).isEqualTo(&quot;http://www.example.com/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testWithQuery() throws Exception {
+        URI uri = new URI(&quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+        Form form = new Form();
+        form.add(&quot;goto&quot;, &quot;http://some.url&quot;);
+        form.add(&quot;state&quot;, &quot;1234567890&quot;);
+        URI withQuery = URIUtil.withQuery(uri, form);
+        // Form uses LinkedHashMap so parameter order is guaranteed.
+        assertThat(withQuery.toString()).isEqualTo(
+                &quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things?goto=http%3A%2F%2Fsome.url&quot;
+                        + &quot;&amp;state=1234567890#breakdance&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testWithoutQueryAndFragment() throws Exception {
+        URI uri = new URI(&quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things?come=to&amp;those=who#breakdance&quot;);
+        URI withoutQueryAndFragment = URIUtil.withoutQueryAndFragment(uri);
+        assertThat(withoutQueryAndFragment.toString()).isEqualTo(
+                &quot;https://doot.doot.doo.org/all/good/things&quot;);
+    }
+
+}
</ins><span class="cx">Property changes on: forgerock-http-framework/trunk/http-core/src/test/java/org/forgerock/http/util/URIUtilTest.java
</span><span class="cx">___________________________________________________________________
